roleset.name: directed motion
roleset.note: CONDUCT-V NOTES: Based on sentences in financial subcorpus.Comparison with lead. Member of VNcls accompany-51.7.(from conduct.01-v)
CONDUCT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry conduct.01,OntoNotes grouping conduct-n sense 2; maps to VN classaccompany-51.7. Framed by Claire. (from conduct.01-n)

example.name: conduct-v: lead an activity
example.text: Urging [LIN directors]-1 *trace*-1 to conduct ``a fair auctionon a level playing field,'' ...

example.name: conduct-v: passivized
example.text: [The study]-1, conducted *trace*-1 by a task force of theBrookings Institution, suggests that Congress should require thecourts to develop the plans.
example.arg: by a task force of the Brookings Institution

example.name: conduct-v: lead music
example.text: I, for instance, was perfectly happy at Avery Fisher Hall the other day listening to Helmuth Rilling conduct the Messa perRossini, a strange piece written by 13 different Italian composersto honor Rossini after his death in 1868.
example.arg: the Messa per Rossini, a strange piece written by 13 different Italian composers to honor Rossini after his death in1868

example.name: conduct-n: NP only, Arg1
example.text: the conduct of a policy that has a long-term rationale
example.arg: of a policy that has a long-term rationale

example.name: conduct-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: Her conduct of the company for the past five years has resulted in double-digit growth.

example.name: conduct-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: The commissioner's conduct of the investigation has been inept and possibly illegal.

roleset.name: behavior
roleset.note: CONDUCT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry conduct.02,OntoNotes grouping conduct-n sense 1; no relevant mapping to VN.Framed by Claire. (from conduct.02-n)

example.name: conduct-n:
example.text: We all thought little Max conducted himself very well.

example.name: conduct-n: Arg0 & LOC
example.text: The child's conduct in front of guests was intolerably rude.

example.name: conduct-n: Arg0 as "of" PP
example.text: This book has tips to help improve the conduct of your pet.

example.name: conduct-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: In rare situations a defendant may clearly demonstrate an acceptance of responsibility for his criminal conduct.

example.name: conduct-n: Args 0 & 1
example.text: She apologized for her improper conduct, and accepted the public reprimand as recommended by the panel.

roleset.name: transmit, be a medium
roleset.note: CONDUCT-V NOTES: Added by Julia. Adjectival 'conductive' based on BOLT-7. (from conduct.03-v)
CONDUCTION-N NOTES: Based on Thyme and Sharp data. Slightcomparison to transmit.01. Transmit is a member of VN classsend-11.1-1. Framed by Katie. (from conduction.01-n)

example.name: conduct-v: both args
example.text: Of the metals, silver conducts electricity the best, although it is relatively expensive.

example.name: conductive-j
example.text: Did practice prove that contempt for the Taiwanese people was not conductive to unification ?
